# Duration.UnitsFormatStyle.UnitWidth

**Structure**

The width of a unit to use in formatting a duration.

## Declaration

```swift
struct UnitWidth
```

## Overview

Use the provided unit widths with the `width` parameter of the [doc://com.apple.Swift/documentation/Swift/Duration/UnitsFormatStyle] initializers to customize the display of units in a formatted string.

## Duration unit widths

- **abbreviated**: An abbreviated unit name.
- **condensedAbbreviated**: An abbreviated unit name, with condensed space between the value and name.
- **narrow**: The shortest possible unit name.
- **wide**: The full unit name.

## Working with unit widths

- **unitWidth**: The width of the unit and the spacing between the value and the unit.

## Conforms To

- Decodable
- Encodable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
